wikipedia_page.main: Captain Frederick Agnew Gill (born May 1873 - died 4 June 1938) was a British army officer and a polo player in the 1900 Summer Olympics. He was polo manager at the Ranelagh Club in London.

link_mentions.page: Sport in the Isle of Man
response: The Isle of Man hosted the IV Commonwealth Youth Games in September 2011. The island started the Island Games in 1985 and hosted them once again in 2001. The most notable international event held on the Isle of Man is the Isle of Man TT motorcycle races, held annually in June. Rower Sidney Swann and cyclist Peter Kennaugh are the only islanders to have won Olympic Games gold medals, while polo player Frederick Agnew Gill won a bronze medal in 1900 and cyclist Mark Cavendish won a silver in 2016. In the Olympic Games, Manx athletes compete in Team GB.
